summary: 3D globe travel app with journey management system. User has identified two key issues: 1) Journey title field not persisting to backend storage, and 2) Journey edit modal lacks full date/time editing capability with only read-only date displays.
architectural_notes: Journey type structure changes require synchronization between Motoko backend and TypeScript frontend
Journey dates act as container for schedule items - changing periods requires validation of all nested items
Schedule items must fall within journey date range for data integrity
known_issues: Journey title field collected in frontend but not persisted to backend (Journey type missing title field)
Journey edit modal shows dates as read-only text - no date picker or time selector available
Journey edit functionality only allows city changes, not date/time modifications

existing_features.title: Replace read-only date displays in the journey edit modal with interactive calendar popovers matching the 'Add New Journey' form implementation, allowing users to select new start and end dates
Add time selection controls to the journey edit modal for both start time and end time, using the same Select components with hour and minute dropdowns as the Add New Journey form

Implement validation in the journey edit modal to ensure all existing schedule items fall within the newly selected journey date range, displaying a clear error message if any schedule items would fall outside the updated period
Update the backend updateJourney function call in the edit modal to include the modified startDate, endDate, and time fields, ensuring the revised journey period is persisted correctly

new_feature_requests.summary: Add full date/time editing capability to journey edit modal with schedule item validation
